forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 60. South southwest wind 13 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the morning unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a muted atmosphere cloaks the city, reminiscent of a well-loved novel left on the shelf for too long. The day is draped in clouds, thick and unyielding, a precursory curtain drawn before the rain begins to fall. With a high flirting with the mid-sixties, the air carries the tang of moisture and a cool breeze that is altogether invigorating yet chillier than you might expect. The South Southwest wind weaves through the streets, a lively chain of whispers that dance between the buildings, while the anticipation of rain bears a certainty of 90% before the sun bids adieu.

As the day wanes into evening, the clouds will deepen, promising fresh rainfalls after the hour strikes eleven. Temperatures will gently lift to around fifty-four, hinting at the comfort of additional layers. Perhaps a light jacket and an umbrella might accompany a leisurely stroll through Washington Square, tracing the edges of the vibrant neighborhood with a warm drink in hand. While the marine layer lends a thickness to the air, obscuring the skyline in places, it also reveals a softness that beckons you to pause and savor the freshness that only city rains can summon. A quiet moment spent in the local cafe, watching the world glisten beyond the window, might just recompense for those cooler moments outside.
